"You can save backups locally or to the cloud. Local backups can be stored on your mobile device, computer, or USB drive.
Mobile device Save your system settings, accounts, app data, and other items in a separate file stored on your device (MIUI-backup-AllBackup). Note: Performing a factory reset will delete such backups permanently. Remember to copy backups to your computer.
Computer Create a backup on this device, then go to MIUI-backup-AllBackup and copy the backup to your computer via USB cable.
USB drive Save your system settings, accounts, app data, and other items to a USB drive.
Xiaomi Cloud Sync your contacts, photos, videos, the list of your apps, system settings, and Home screen layout with the cloud."
How can I back up items?

"You can only encrypt local backups. Here are some encryption methods you can use: a) Go to Settings > Additional settings on the page with your local backups, tap the button to turn on encryption, and sign in to your Xiaomi Account. Backups will be encrypted automatically after that. Remember that you'll need to sign in to your Xiaomi Account to restore items from encrypted backups. b) If you're using Mi PC Suite to back up items, you can use encryption options there.
Note: Remember the password you set for encrypted backups! You won't be able to decrypt your backups if you forget it."
How do I encrypt my backups?

"Here's how you can restore items that were backed up using different methods:
Mobile device Tap \"Mobile device\", find the option to restore items, and select the backup to continue.
Computer Copy the backup from your computer to MIUI-backup-AllBackup via USB cable and restore items from your mobile device.
USB drive Copy the backup from your USB drive to MIUI-backup-AllBackup and select the option to restore items from a USB drive to continue.
Xiaomi Cloud Open Xiaomi Cloud and restore items from there."
How do I restore backed up items?

Fingerprint Unlock creates a unique model of your fingerprint to verify it’s you. To create this fingerprint model during setup, you will take images of your fingerprint from different positions.

When you use Pixel Imprint, images are used to update your fingerprint model. Images used to create your fingerprint model are never stored, but the fingerprint model is stored securely on your phone and never leaves the phone. All processing occurs securely on your phone.
You can delete your fingerprint images and model, or turn off Fingerprint Unlock at any time in Settings. Fingerprint images and models are stored on the phone until you delete them.
Your phone can be unlocked when you don’t intend to, like if someone holds it up to your finger.
For best results, use a screen protector that’s Made for Google certified. With other screen protectors, your fingerprint may not work.

Fingerprint Unlock creates a unique model of your child’s fingerprint to verify it’s them. To create this fingerprint model during setup, they will take images of their fingerprint from different positions.

When they use Pixel Imprint, images are used to update their fingerprint model. Images used to create your child’s fingerprint model are never stored, but the fingerprint model is stored securely on the phone and never leaves the phone. All processing occurs securely on the phone.
You and your child can delete their fingerprint images and model, or turn off Fingerprint Unlock at any time in Settings. Fingerprint images and models are stored on the phone until they’re deleted.
